description: Validation templates for normalizing validation contracts across dimensions with PDET municipality context enrichment

pdet_enrichment.description: PDET municipality context validations ensure territorial targeting, resource alignment, and contextual accuracy for 170 municipalities across 16 subregions

gate_1_scope.description: Consumer scope validation - ensures consumers have authorization to access PDET context

gate_2_value_contribution.description: Value-add validation - ensures PDET context materially improves validation process

gate_3_capability_readiness.description: Capability validation - ensures consumers can process PDET territorial data

gate_4_channel_integrity.description: Channel validation - ensures PDET data flow is explicit, traceable, and governed

pdet_municipality_criteria.legal_basis: Decreto Ley 893 de 2017 + Acuerdo de Paz Punto 1

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates diagnostic rigor with territorial coverage and official sources
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: Diagnóstico territorial must cite DANE, local observatories, or official registries

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates baseline indicators have quantitative values, sources, and temporal references
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: DNP requires baselines with at least 3-year time series for trend analysis

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates that gaps between current state and desired state are explicitly identified
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: Brechas must be quantified (e.g., 'current: 45%, target: 80%, gap: 35 p.p.')

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates identification of available resources and resource gaps
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: Must reference SGP, royalties, or other financing sources
PDET municipalities must disaggregate data to vereda level when possible

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates if municipality is PDET and applies specific validation criteria

checks.municipality_identification: Verify municipality code against 170 PDET municipalities
checks.subregion_alignment: Validate subregion (1 of 16) for contextual accuracy
checks.ethnic_composition: Include ethnic population disaggregation when applicable

DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: PDET municipalities (Decreto 893/2017) require enhanced territorial diagnostic citing PATR, OCAD Paz investments, and conflict-sensitive indicators

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates identification of PDET-specific resources (OCAD Paz, Obras por Impuestos, PATR initiatives)
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: PDET municipalities must explicitly reference OCAD Paz projects, PATR initiatives (avg 193 per municipality), and coordination with ART (Agencia de Renovación del Territorio)

DIM01_INSUMOS.description: Validates alignment with PDET 8 pillars (Reforma Rural Integral, infraestructura, salud, educación, etc.)
DIM01_INSUMOS.colombian_context: PDET municipal diagnostics must demonstrate alignment with at least 2 of 8 PDET pillars, with explicit reference to Plan Marco de Implementación (PMI)

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.description: Verifies explicit causal connections between activity and problem
DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.colombian_context: Activities in Colombian PDMs must explicitly link to diagnosed problems

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.description: Validates that activities have corresponding budget allocation
DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.colombian_context: BPIN/SIGOP numbering required for Colombian investment projects
Secretaría, entidad, or dependencia must be named
Activities must fit within 4-year mayoral term

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.description: Validates coordination with PATR (Plan de Acción para la Transformación Regional) initiatives

checks.patr_reference: Activities explicitly reference PATR initiative IDs
checks.active_route_status: Status of activities in PATR Ruta de Implementación
checks.art_coordination: Coordination mechanisms with Agencia de Renovación del Territorio

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.colombian_context: PDET municipalities must coordinate activities with PATR initiatives (avg 193 initiatives per municipality, 62% completion rate). Activities should reference specific PATR initiative codes

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.description: Validates alignment with OCAD Paz investment decisions and sectoral priorities
DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.colombian_context: Activities in PDET municipalities requiring major investment (>$1,000M COP) must align with OCAD Paz approved projects. Total OCAD Paz investment: $1.76 trillion COP across 170 municipalities

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.description: Validates municipal capacity to execute activities given fiscal autonomy constraints

checks.fiscal_autonomy_level: Consider 88.8% of PDET municipalities are category 6 (muy baja autonomía)
checks.icld_capacity: Municipal free disposal income (ICLD) averaging 1,850 SMMLV for category 6
checks.institutional_presence: ART, ANT presence and support mechanisms
checks.technical_assistance: Need for national entity support (DNP, sector ministries)

DIM02_ACTIVIDADES.colombian_context: PDET municipalities have low fiscal autonomy (category 6) and require national support. Activities must acknowledge institutional capacity constraints and include technical assistance provisions

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates products are concretely specified with measurable indicators
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Products (bienes y servicios) must follow BPIN structure: quantity + unit + timeframe

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates indicator has explicit calculation formula
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Formula must be verifiable (e.g., '(Número de viviendas mejoradas / Total viviendas) * 100')

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product has designated verification source and responsible entity
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Source must be official (DANE, SISBEN, Sistema de Información sectorial)

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product is linked to budget allocation in PPI
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Must reference specific line in Plan Plurianual de Inversiones (PPI)

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product is traceable to specific activities (DIM02)
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: Products must derive from activities via clear input-output logic

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates product has annualized delivery schedule
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: 4-year term must show phased delivery (e.g., Year 1: 25%, Year 2: 30%, Year 3: 30%, Year 4: 15%)

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates products are targeted at appropriate territorial level (vereda, corregimiento, subregion)

checks.vereda_disaggregation: Products specify target veredas (11,000 veredas across PDET)
checks.ethnic_targeting: Specific targeting for Indigenous/Afrodescendant communities when applicable

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: PDET products must specify territorial targeting at vereda level (11,000 veredas). Rural coverage essential given 24% rural population concentration

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates delivery assumptions are realistic given security and access challenges

checks.security_considerations: Acknowledge security challenges in conflict-affected areas
checks.institutional_presence: State presence and reach in remote veredas

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: PDET product delivery must account for: (1) security volatility in post-conflict zones, (2) limited road infrastructure (dominant OCAD Paz sector: Transporte), (3) dispersed rural population

DIM03_PRODUCTOS.description: Validates integration with PATR monitoring and OCAD Paz reporting systems
DIM03_PRODUCTOS.colombian_context: PDET products must integrate with Central de Información PDET monitoring system and report to OCAD Paz for investment tracking (current avg: 110M COP per subregion)

DIM04_RESULTADOS.description: Verifies outcomes are traceable to products
DIM04_RESULTADOS.colombian_context: Results must derive from products (Ley 152 de 1994)

DIM04_RESULTADOS.description: Validates outcome indicators have baseline, target, and unit

DIM04_RESULTADOS.colombian_context: DNP requires measurable outcomes for follow-up

DIM04_RESULTADOS.description: Validates alignment with Plan Marco de Implementación (PMI) outcome indicators

checks.pmi_reference: Explicit reference to PMI indicator framework
checks.pillar_contribution: Contribution to specific PDET pillar outcomes
checks.territorial_measurement: Measurement at subregion or municipality level

DIM04_RESULTADOS.colombian_context: PDET outcomes must align with PMI indicator framework and demonstrate contribution to Peace Agreement implementation. Reference to 8 PDET pillars required

DIM04_RESULTADOS.description: Validates baseline accounts for conflict legacy and multidimensional poverty

checks.multidimensional_poverty: Baseline acknowledges avg 46.8% poverty rate in PDET

DIM04_RESULTADOS.colombian_context: PDET baselines must acknowledge structural deficits: multidimensional poverty (46.8% avg), low institutional presence, conflict history. Realistic improvement targets given 15-year planning horizon

DIM04_RESULTADOS.description: Validates outcomes are benchmarked against peer PDET municipalities or subregion averages

checks.category_peers: Compare against category 6 municipalities (88.8% of PDET)
checks.ethnic_context_peers: Compare with municipalities of similar ethnic composition

DIM04_RESULTADOS.colombian_context: PDET outcome targets should be realistic given peer performance. Use subregion statistics and category 6 benchmarks for target setting

DIM05_IMPACTOS.description: Verifies impact chain from outcomes to long-term impacts
DIM05_IMPACTOS.colombian_context: Impacts are long-term (10+ years) structural changes

DIM05_IMPACTOS.description: Validates impact aligns with theory of change
DIM05_IMPACTOS.colombian_context: Must align with Teoría de Cambio del PDM
Impact targets must be ambitious yet municipality-feasible

DIM05_IMPACTOS.description: Validates impacts explicitly contribute to Peace Agreement implementation (Acuerdo de Paz 2016)

checks.reconciliation: Community reconciliation and social fabric rebuilding

DIM05_IMPACTOS.colombian_context: PDET impacts must demonstrate direct contribution to Peace Agreement (especially Punto 1 - RRI). 15-year horizon aligns with PMI implementation timeline

DIM05_IMPACTOS.description: Validates impacts address structural territorial gaps (Estado-Territorio closure)

checks.institutional_presence: Closing state presence gaps in remote areas
checks.basic_service_access: Universal access to health, education, justice

DIM05_IMPACTOS.colombian_context: PDET impacts must address Estado-Territorio closure: bringing state services to historically abandoned territories. Focus on structural transformation beyond traditional service delivery

DIM05_IMPACTOS.description: Validates impacts consider sustainability beyond PDET program lifecycle

checks.institutional_capacity: Local institutional capacity building for post-PDET autonomy
checks.private_sector_engagement: Private sector and productive chains development

DIM05_IMPACTOS.colombian_context: PDET is 15-year transitional program. Long-term impacts must consider post-PDET sustainability, especially fiscal (88.8% category 6 municipalities with muy baja autonomía fiscal)

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Verifies complete causal chain from activities to impacts
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Cadena de resultados must be complete

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates key assumptions are explicitly stated
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Supuestos y riesgos must be documented

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Detects circular reasoning or logical fallacies
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Common fallacy: 'we will achieve X by achieving X'

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates causal logic is adapted to municipal context
DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: Causal mechanisms must reflect municipal realities

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates causal chains account for conflict legacy and peacebuilding requirements

checks.conflict_drivers: Causal analysis includes historical conflict drivers
checks.security_preconditions: Security as enabler/constraint in causal chain
checks.trust_building: Community trust and institutional legitimacy building

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: PDET causal logic must be conflict-sensitive: acknowledge that traditional development causality may not hold in post-conflict contexts. Security, trust, and reconciliation are preconditions for service delivery effectiveness

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates causal mechanisms adapted to PDET territorial realities (remoteness, ethnic diversity, institutional weakness)

checks.geographic_isolation: Causality accounts for remoteness and access challenges
checks.institutional_capacity: Realistic assumptions about municipal execution capacity (category 6)
checks.community_participation: PATR participatory planning as causal mechanism

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: PDET territories are highly heterogeneous: geographic isolation, ethnic diversity (38 Afro-majority, 22 Indigenous-majority), weak institutions. Causal chains must adapt to these realities, not assume standard urban/central municipality conditions

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates causal assumptions grounded in PATR empirical evidence and PDET subregion learning

checks.patr_lessons_learned: Reference PATR implementation lessons (62% completion rate)
checks.subregion_evidence: Evidence from peer municipalities in same subregion
checks.ocad_paz_evaluations: OCAD Paz project evaluations and impact evidence
checks.art_technical_inputs: ART technical guidance and territorial diagnostics

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: PDET causal assumptions must be empirically grounded in PATR evidence (32,808 initiatives, 62% completion rate), OCAD Paz evaluations, and ART territorial diagnostics. Avoid importing unvalidated causality from non-PDET contexts

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.description: Validates causal logic recognizes multi-actor coordination requirements (national, regional, local, community)

checks.art_coordination: Agencia de Renovación del Territorio facilitation role
checks.community_governance: Community organizations and PATR governance structures

DIM06_CAUSALIDAD.colombian_context: PDET implementation requires unprecedented multi-level governance coordination. Causal chains must explicitly model: (1) national entities (DNP, ART, sector ministries), (2) departmental coordination, (3) inter-municipal cooperation, (4) community participation. Single-actor causality insufficient
